item.title: Integration Test With Database in Golang
item.description: Software testing is a process used to identify the correctness, completeness, and quality of developed computer software. There are so many kinds of software testing. Start from unit-testing, load-testing, stress-testing, integration-testing, UI-testing, e2e-testing, and many more.

item.title: Today I Learned - Fix: go get private repository return error terminal prompts disabled
item.description: I’ve some project stored separated in 3 git-host providers: Github, Gitlab, and Bitbucket. Because I was a low-profile software engineer, I use both in Gitlab and Bitbucket for the private repository and Github for public repository XD.

item.title: Today I Learned: Making a Simple Interactive Shell Application in Golang
item.description: So today, I learn something new and a bit of basic thing in Golang. It was making a simple interactive shell. It was just a very simple application, but it kinda looks cool to make it.

item.title: CI/CD at Kurio Backend with Buddy.Works
item.description: On my first time joining Kurio Engineering team, a year ago before I wrote this story, we already used CI/CD flow in every teams (mobile team, backend team, and data science team).

item.title: The Daily Life of a Software Engineer in Jakarta
item.description: In this article, I will share what my typical daily looks like as Software Engineer in Jakarta.

item.title: My honest opinion about Unit Testing
item.description: Imagine now you are in the kitchen. You are going to make an omelet. Then, you must prepare the tools first, a stove, a pan, fried spoon, a knife etc. Then, you also must have the needs, such as eggs, pepper, salt etc.

item.title: My First Impression about Code Review
item.description: My first time to know about Code Review is when entering my current company at Kurio. In my past company before here, we never doing any code review. So everything is just passed to staging-branch and if tested well merge directly to master.

item.title: Programming as a Passion vs Programming as a Job

item.title: Faker
item.description: Faker will generate you a fake data based on your Struct.

item.title: Saint
item.description:
Source code: github

Download

go get -u github.com/bxcodec/saint

Example

package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"github.com/bxcodec/saint"
)

func main() {


 arr:=[] int {2,1,3,5,6}
 var x int

 x= saint.Max(arr...)
 fmt.Println(x) // 6

 x= saint.Max(4,3,1,5,7)
 fmt.Println(x) // 7

 x= saint.Min(arr...)
 fmt.Println(x) // 1

 x= saint.Min(4,3,5,5,7)
 fmt.Println(x) // 3

 x= saint.Sum(arr...)
 fmt.Println(x) // 17

 x = saint.Sum(4,5)
 fmt.Println(x) // 9
}
